content.description: Climb the beautiful orange face just to the right of "Meeting the Siskin". The first couple of bolts of climbing are straightforward and fun. Then make some longer and more powerful moves through beautiful stone. It's on ya somewhat until you clip the anchors.
content.location: Right side of arete located at the left side of the wall that forms the back of the cirque.

content.description: Clip 2 bolts on the way to the left trending corner. Follow corner to a ledge, clip the bolt, then tiptoe right and roll around arete. Follow the point of the arete clear to to the tip of the tongue.
content.protection: 9+ bolts and few pieces of gear. Ring anchors

content.description: Climb jugs to an obvious left-leaning ramp. Romp up face to anchors which are lower than you would expect.
content.location: find obvious left leaning ramp two bolt lines to the left of "Don't Stop Now".

content.description: A user-friendly sport route, worth doing if in the area.
content.location: Approach from Whippoorwill when the lake is low (winter) or by boat. If approaching from Whippoorwill, after the leaning pillar that forms a tunnel, Meeting the Siskin is on the sixth major arete, just before a long, straight wall. If approaching by boat, look for the long, straight wall, and go to its left.

content.description: Start from atop a boulder at the tip of the formation. Scamper up ledges, clipping the bolts on the left side of the awsome arete. Continue past the big hemlock in the alcove and on to the top. Hold your nose and wave to the buzzards.

Moderately easy crimpy face climbing for the first 50 feet or so - a handful of nice rests to prep for a long (for tall folks) or dynamic (for the rest of the world) last move to pull over a baby roof to the anchors. Fun climbing through and through; well worth the trek.
content.location: If you've approached coming in from Whippoorwill, follow the U-shaped cliff line around to the right - you'll come to a flat clearing with a few boulders and some rhodo behind you as you face the wall. The route is the bolt line up the face before it juts in to a little roof.

content.description:
Climb the obvious 1" splitter crack that splits the back wall of the cirque. The crux is getting established in the crack. Begin in the back of the left-facing corner at the base of the crack, work your way around, plug a piece, and establish thyself in the crack. Harvest said crack.

Alternative start: boulder your way directly to the crack, stepping on lichen and wishing you brought a bouldering pad. This likely makes the route harder than 5.10.
content.protection: Mostly fingers to thin hands towards top.
content.location: obvious splitter 1" crack splitting the back wall of the cirque
